enablePolymorphism.description: Whether or not to use the `discriminator`/`oneOf` pattern to output schemas in cases where the valid set of fields can vary based on some attribute of the data such as the country or subtype.  Defaults to `true`. See the Cloud API documentation for more information.
enablePolymorphism.name: enablePolymorphism

fields.description: Allows the caller to specify the set of fields that should be included on the response. This can be used to limit the set of fields returned as well as to include optional fields that otherwise wouldn't normally be returned. The parameter is either of the form `fields=<field list>` or `fields=<include>:<field list>`, where `<field list>` consists of a comma-separated list of field or field set names. See the Cloud API documentation for more information.
fields.name: fields

filter.description: Filters the list of results based on the specified field, operator, and value. The parameter is either of the form `filter=<field>:<operator>:<value>` or `filter=<include>:<field>:<operator>:<value>`. See the Cloud API documentation for more information.
filter.name: filter

filterByUser.description: Whether or not to filter endpoints and schema properties by the authorization of the caller. Defaults to `false`.
filterByUser.name: filterByUser

gwLanguageHeader.description: If specified, this header will set the language used when processing the request
gwLanguageHeader.name: GW-Language

gwLocaleHeader.description: If specified, this header will set the locale used when processing the request
gwLocaleHeader.name: GW-Locale

gwSchemaProperty.description: If specified and the operation returns json with a defined schema, this will add a property, '$GW-Schema',  with the fully qualified name of the object's schema.
gwSchemaProperty.name: GW-IncludeSchemaProperty

gwTraceability.description: This header permits a customer to trace a request from its initial reception through all of the subsequent applications that were invoked to handle that request. The actual traceability id present in the MDC and logs (and returned in the response), is dependent on the implementation of TraceabilityIDPlugin. The default implementation uses this value, if specified, or a generated UID.  However, another implementation may always generate a unique id and just log  the relationship between these incoming values and the generated UID. Note: that this header can be repeated, but the resulting string will just be the comma separated values.
gwTraceability.name: X-Correlation-ID

gwTransactionID.description: If specified and this operation results in a database commit, this header's value must not have been submitted before.  This value must be globally unique across all clients, apis and webservices. It is used for those transaction that are not idempotent. Unless this is explicitly referenced for an operation it is not required.
gwTransactionID.name: GW-DBTransaction-ID

gwUnknownPropertyHeader.description: If specified, this header will drive the behavior for unknown property handling
gwUnknownPropertyHeader.name: GW-UnknownPropertyHandling

gwUnknownQueryParameterHeader.description: If specified, this header will drive the behavior for unknown query parameter handling.  Default is to reject them.
gwUnknownQueryParameterHeader.name: GW-UnknownQueryParamHandling

gwValidateResponseHandling.description: If specified, this header permits the client to override the behavior around validating response
gwValidateResponseHandling.name: GW-ValidateResponseHandling

include.description: Used to request that additional resources be returned with the API response in the `included` section of the response envelope. The `include` parameter can appear multiple times, and is a comma-separated list of additional resources to include. See the Cloud API documentation for more information.
include.name: include

includeTotal.description: Used to request that results should include a count of the total number of results available, which may be more than the total number of results currently being returned. This parameter is of the form `includeTotal=<true|false>` or `includeTotal=<include>:<true|false>`. If not specified, the default is considered to be `false`. See the Cloud API documentation for more information about response pagination.
includeTotal.name: includeTotal

pageOffset.description: The offset of the first result to fetch when fetching a paginated set of results. The parameter is of the form `pageOffset=<number>` where the first result has an offset of 0. For example, `pageOffset=25` will skip the first 25 results in sorted order. If not specified, the default value is 0. See the Cloud API documentation for more information about response pagination.
pageOffset.name: pageOffset

pageSize.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response. The parameter is of the form `pageSize=<size>` or `pageSize=<include>:<size>`. The maximum allowed `pageSize` and the default `pageSize` both depend on the specific API endpoint the request is made to. See the Cloud API documentation for more information about response pagination.
pageSize.name: pageSize

prettyPrintSchema.description: Whether or not to pretty-print the returned schema, making it larger but more human readable.  Defaults to `false`.
prettyPrintSchema.name: prettyPrint

sort.description: Controls the sorting of elements within a response. The sort parameter is of the form `sort=<fields>` or `sort=<include>:<fields>`, where `<fields>` represents a comma-separated list of field names to sort on. Field names can be prefixed with `-` to request a descending sort, otherwise the sort will be ascending. See the Cloud API documentation for more information.
sort.name: sort

userId.description: The REST identifier for the user
userId.name: userId

BatchRequest.description: The body of a batch request
BatchRequest.title: Batch request

BatchResponse.description: The body of a response to a batch request. The `responses` field will have one element for every entry in the `requests` field on the request, and responses will appear in the same order.

responses.description: The list of subresponses, appearing in the same order as the elements in the `requests` field of the request
responses.title: Responses

BatchResponse.title: Batch response

BatchSubRequest.description: An individual subrequest within a batch request

headers.description: Headers that will be included as part of the subrequest. Any headers defined using this field will override header values inherited from the main request. Any headers present on the main request that are not defined in this list will be inherited when the subrequest is made, with the exception of the `GW-Checksum` header.
headers.title: Headers

method.description: The HTTP method for the subrequest
method.title: Method

onFail.description: Controls whether or not subsequent subrequests are processed if this subrequest fails. The default behavior is to continue processing subrequests. The `abort` option specifies that all subsequent subrequests will be skipped.
onFail.title: On fail

path.description: The path for the subrequest. This path is relative to the root of the API hosting the batch endpoint. For example, if the batch endpoint is `<servlet>/rest/common/v1/batch`, then a path of `/activities` will mean a request against `<servlet>/rest/common/v1/activities`. The path must start with `/` and cannot contain whitespace.
path.title: Path

query.description: The query string to use for the subrequest
query.title: Query

BatchSubRequest.title: Batch subrequest

BatchSubResponse.description: A subresponse to a batch subrequest

code.description: The HTTP status code for the subresponse
code.title: Code

headers.description: The headers returned for the subresponse
headers.title: Headers

skipped.description: A `true` value indicates that the corresponding subrequest was not processed due to a prior failed request that specified the `onFail` field with the `abort` option
skipped.title: Skipped

BatchSubResponse.title: Batch subresponse

Header.description: An HTTP request or response header
Header.title: Header

methods.description: An array of HTTP method names that can be used with the link URL
methods.title: Methods

additionalProperties.description: A set of named links. Each key represents the name of the link, such as a child of the current element, an action that can be taken on it, or a navigation option.
additionalProperties.title: Links

PhoneNumber.description: A phone number, with different components of the number broken out as separate fields

countryCode.description: The country code for the phone number
countryCode.title: Country code

displayName.description: The phone number formatted in a standardized way
displayName.title: Display name

extension.description: The extension for the phone number
extension.title: Extension

number.description: The actual phone number, including area code, but excluding the country code and extension
number.title: Number

PhoneNumber.title: Phone number

RelatedCollection.description: A set of element references that are related to the element in some way. Used to link elements with their relations when a request is made using the `include` query parameter.

count.description: The number of elements included in the `data` array
count.title: Count

data.description: The list of references to the related elements
data.title: Data

total.description: The total number of elements in the related set of elements. Only present if the `includeTotal` query parameter is used to request that the total be calculated for an included collection.
total.title: Total

RelatedCollection.title: Related collection

additionalProperties.description: The related collections. Each key in this object will match the name of the inclusion requested via the `include` query parameter.
additionalProperties.title: Related collections

RelatedCollections.description: A set of `RelatedCollection` elements that contain references to elements included using the `include` query parameter on a request
RelatedCollections.title: Related collections

Role.description: A named role within the system

carrierInternal.description: A `true` value indicates that the role is applicable to users internal to the carrier organization
carrierInternal.title: Carrier internal

displayName.description: The formatted name of the role
displayName.title: Display name

Role.title: Role

checksum.description: A checksum for the element that can be used to prevent lost updates by detecting that the element has been updated since the caller last retrieved it. See the Cloud API documentation for more information about lost update prevention.
checksum.title: Checksum

id.description: The unique identifier of the element
id.title: ID

links.description: Links related to the specific element, including child elements and actions that can be taken on the element. Links are sensitive to both the caller's permissions and the state of the data. Only applicable to response envelopes.
links.title: Links

method.description: The HTTP method that should be used for an included element. Only applicable to request envelopes. See the Cloud API documentation for more information about request inclusion.
method.title: Method

refid.description: Used to assign a temporary identifier to an element created using request inclusion. Only applicable to request envelopes. See the Cloud API documentation for more information about request inclusion.
refid.title: Reference ID

related.description: Information about collections and elements related to this element that have been included on the response due to use of the `include` query parameter on the request. Only applicable to response envelopes. See the Cloud API documentation for more information about read inclusion.
related.title: Related

uri.description: The URI for an included element, representing the parent to create the element on if the `method` is `post` or the element to update if the `method` is `patch`. Only applicable to request envelopes. See the Cloud API documentation for more information about request inclusion.
uri.title: URI

count.description: The number of elements currently being returned. This may be less than the total number of elements. Pagination links under the `links` property can be used to determine if additional pages of results are available.
count.title: Count

links.description: Links related to the overall list of elements, used to paginate the list
links.title: Links

total.description: The total number of elements available, which may be greater than the `count` of elements currently being returned. Only included on responses if the `includeTotal` query parameter is used to request that the `total` be calculated.  Capped at 1000.
total.title: Total

displayName.description: The formatted name of the element
displayName.title: Display name

id.description: The unique identifier of the referenced element
id.title: ID

jsonPath.description: The path to the referenced element within the overall JSON document
jsonPath.title: JSON path

refid.description: A unique identifier given to the newly created element in the context of the current request
refid.title: Reference ID

type.description: The type of the referenced element
type.title: Type

uri.description: The canonical URI for the referenced element
uri.title: URI

TypeKeyReference.description: A reference to a `TypeKey` element that defines an enumerated value from a `TypeList`
TypeKeyReference.title: TypeKey reference

User.description: A named user within the system

active.description: A `true` value indicates that the user is currently active and allowed to log in. A `false` value indicates the user has been deactivated and cannot currently log in.
active.title: Active

cellPhone.description: The cell phone number for the user
cellPhone.title: Cell phone

employeeNumber.description: The employee number assigned to the user
employeeNumber.title: Employee number

externalUser.description: A `true` value indicates that the user represents a user from an external organization, rather than a user from within the insurer's organization
externalUser.title: External user

firstName.description: The first name of the user
firstName.title: First name

homePhone.description: The home phone number for the user
homePhone.title: Home phone

lastName.description: The last name of the user
lastName.title: Last name

roles.description: The roles assigned to the user
roles.title: Roles

suffix.description: The name suffix of the user
suffix.title: Suffix

vacationStatus.description: Indicates whether the user is considered to be on vacation
vacationStatus.title: Vacation status

workPhone.description: The work phone number for the user
workPhone.title: Work phone

post.description: Post a list of subrequests to make against this endpoint. Subrequests will be executed serially, in the order they are specified in the "requests" property of the input. Responses to each subrequest will then be batched up and returned all together. Subrequests inherit the headers from the main request, with the exception of the GW-Checksum header, but headers can be specified on the subrequest and will override any headers from the main request.

parameters.description: Controls what response headers, if any, are included for subresponses. If unspecified, or set to the value "*all", all headers for subresponses will be returned. If set to the value "*none", no headers for subresponses will be returned. Otherwise, this parameter can consist of a comma-separated list of the names of headers that should be included on subresponses.
parameters.name: includeResponseHeaders

requestBody.description: The body of the batch request

200.description: The batch request itself was well-formed; individual subrequests may have succeeded or failed

post.summary: Issue multiple requests at once as a non-transactional batch

get.description: Return the Open API 3.0 representation of the schema
get.summary: Return the Open API 3.0 representation of the schema

get.description: Returns a Swagger 2.0 schema for this API as json
get.summary: Returns the Swagger schema for this API

201.description: The details of the newly-created user

get.description: Returns details for a single user
